DataElement.preferredName: Imaging Agent Net Radioactivity Administered Float 16 Character Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Imaging Agent Net Radioactivity Administered (0018,1074) is the radiopharmaceutical net dose administered to the patient measured in MegaBecquerels (Mbq) at the Radiopharmaceutical Start Time (0018,1072).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The imaging agent (radiopharmaceutical) net dose administered to the patient measured at the Radiopharmaceutical Start Time (0018,1072).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: In medicine, any technology which helps in visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for the screening, diagnosis, surgical procedure or therapy.:An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: In medicine, any technology which helps in visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for the screening, diagnosis, surgical procedure or therapy.
An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.

Property.preferredDefinition: Ultimate; final; remaining after all deductions, outlay, or loss.:The quality of emitting or the emission of corpuscular or electromagnetic radiations consequent to nuclear disintegration, a natural property of all chemical elements of atomic number above 83 and possible of induction in all other known elements.:Given.

Concepts.definition: Ultimate; final; remaining after all deductions, outlay, or loss.

The quality of emitting or the emission of corpuscular or electromagnetic radiations consequent to nuclear disintegration, a natural property of all chemical elements of atomic number above 83 and possible of induction in all other known elements.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/29/10 Released for use in Image SUV Calculation Module.  1/13/01 - revised OC to "image agent" per IMGCRF discussion.  1/3/2010 - created to support Image SUV CRF module.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: DS: A string of characters representing either a fixed point number or a floating point number. A fixed point number shall contain only the characters 0-9 with an optional leading "+" or "-" and an optional "." to mark the decimal point. A floating point number shall be conveyed as defined in ANSI X3.9, with an "E" or "e" to indicate the start of the exponent. Decimal Strings may be padded with leading or trailing spaces. Embedded spaces are not allowed.  (valid characters 0-9, +,-, E,e,".") [Standard-based]

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An expression consisting of a linear sequence of symbols (characters or words or phrases).:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: An expression consisting of a linear sequence of symbols (characters or words or phrases).
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 10/27/08 - released post NCIA Interim Rpt Changes;  12/31/07 - chg long & short name to reflect "floating" aspect of value domain as indicated in the definition; semantics and max/min length did not change.  6/8/07-typo in def corrected.  6/4/07-Removed 15 decimal requirement.  5/10/07- Changed long to match Rep term qualifiers.  1/6/07-released VD so it can be reused in other imaging CDE.  1/4/07-2006 DICOM Standard - Sections 5 & 6
